item.title: Vidcast #38 - The 20/20 Vision Campaign
item.description:
The 20/20 Vision is arguably one of the most exciting new initiatives involving media and mission today. The goal of the 20/20 Vision is "To produce and distribute an indigenous evangelistic audio-visual tool for every one of the Least Evangelized Mega Peoples by the year 2020, so that all can clearly see and understand the gospel message and embrace it as their own". For more information contact: Calvin and Carol Conkey, Create International, creategcrc@gmail.com http://www.createinternational.com/, http://www.global2020vision.com/



If you would like to get some of these evangelistic films down-loadable for free go to: www.indigitech.net Surf to our homepage and check it out!
Please remember to vote for our podcast at: , and Visit our Odeo Channel

Subscribe to this podcast:

item.title: Episode 21 - Living for the Desire of God
item.description:
Calvin Conkey works with Create International, a media ministry of Youth With A Mission. Here Calvin shares the heart and passion behind their ministry and the Frontier Mission movement around the world. Be inspired to do all you can to see the gospel message go to the remaining unreached peoples. item.title: Episode #56 - Indigenous Films to reach the Nations
item.description:
This is a compelling interview with Calvin Conkey co-founder and director of Create International. We have all heard of the wonderful work that has been done by the Jesus Film Project which is now in over 1000 languages. But as effective as it has been it is a film which was done over 40 years ago for a "western audience". Today God is raising up an army of filmmakers who are working together with the indigenous unreached peoples to produce dynamic and professional quality evangelistic films. Create International is one such ministry which the Lord has equipped and called to produce these kinds of media resources. Listen to God Network News as we unveil this marvelous ministry. Wow, what amazing things God is doing in these days. If you would like to get some of these evangelistic films down-loadable for free go to: www.indigitech.net Surf to our homepage and check it out!
Please remember to vote for our podcast at: , and Visit our Odeo Channel

Subscribe to this podcast:

item.title: Gospel Gadgets Podcast - Vidcast #36 -"Dimitri and the Russian iPod"
item.description:
Another hilarious gadget minute from our favorite Ex-KGB agent, Dimitri. Learn how the Russians had their own iPod many years before we got this technology in the West! Dimitri reveals this gadget and demonstrates its amazing capabilities. You don't want to miss this episode of the "Gadget Minute". Enjoy!

Surf to our homepage and check it out!

Please remember to vote for our podcast at: , and Visit our Odeo Channel

item.title: Vidcast #20 - Simple Church
item.description:
What is the Simple Church? Join us as we discover the roots of the original Church. We have the privilege of presenting to you Brian Hogan the author of, "There's a Sheep in my Bathtub". Which is the audio book that we have been sharing with all of you for the past few months. If you liked his book you will love this interview.
This interview is courtesy of GlobalCast Podcast. You can find them in iTunes, subscribe and enjoy!
If you would like to get some of these evangelistic films down-loadable for free go to: www.indigitech.net Surf to our homepage and check it out!
Please remember to vote for our podcast at: , and Visit our Odeo Channel

item.title: Vidcast #19 - The Early Church vs. the Modern Church
item.description:
Why does the modern church look so different from the early church? Where did all of this ritual and culture come from? Do we need it? Does it help or hinder the growth of Christianity around the world? We have the privilege of presenting to you Brian Hogan the author of, "There's a Sheep in my Bathtub". Which is the audio book that we have been sharing with all of you for the past few months. If you liked his book you will love this interview.
This interview is courtesy of GlobalCast Podcast. You can find them in iTunes, subscribe and enjoy!
If you would like to get some of these evangelistic films down-loadable for free go to: www.indigitech.net Surf to our homepage and check it out!
Please remember to vote for our podcast at: , and Visit our Odeo Channel

item.title: Vidcast #18 - Gospel Gadget Testimony from India
item.description:
A great testimony from a short-term team from Brazil working in India. This video not only shows the language and cultural struggles that a team has working in India; but it also demonstrates in a dynamic way the effectiveness of using portable media players and appropriate evangelistic films! This is a must see! If you would like to get some of these evangelistic films down-loadable for free go to: www.indigitech.net Surf to our homepage and check it out!
Please remember to vote for our podcast at: , and Visit our Odeo Channel

Subscribe to this podcast:

item.description:
Chapter five (5) of the exciting book called "There's a Sheep in my Bathtub". A story of the Hogan family's experiences while working among the Khalka Mongols of Outer Mongolia. Surf to our homepage and check it out!

item.title: VidCast #11 - I.T. Missionaries and the Internet
item.description:
Loren Cunningham, Founder of Youth With A Mission, shares how he believes that God is raising up a new type of "I.T." missionary that will use the Internet to advance the Kingdom of God. He speaks of the historical and spiritual significance of major technological advances in the past, and projects a similar dynamic with the coming of the Internet. Surf to our homepage and check it out at!
Please support GNN by getting your domain names at:

item.title: Episode #24 - Shiite Muslims Making Christ Lord and Savior
item.description:
Shiite Muslims are being attracted to the blood and sacrifice of Jesus Christ, who in the Quran is known as "Isa Al Masih". Don't miss this episode where we interview a missionary couple working with this Muslim people cluster somewhere in the Middle East. They are seeing the working of God's spirit in the lives of these people, and it is exciting to be a part of it! Shiite Bride Website Please stay tuned and remember to vote for our podcast at: and

My Odeo Channel (odeo/d7ef23bf25c45158)

item.title: Episode #22 - Global Impact of Non-western Missions
item.description:
We look at the global impact of 60% of todays total mission force which is from the non-western world. The phrase "Global South" is rapidly becoming the new term of choice to represent the growing mission force from the southern hemisphere or non-western countries of the world. Listen to this speaker who grew up in the former Soviet Union and now is a leader with the "Global South" mission thrust. Please stay tuned and remember to vote for our podcast at: and

My Odeo Channel (odeo/d7ef23bf25c45158)

item.title: Episode #19 - What God is Doing Pt1 - mp3
item.description:
Fred Markert is back with some new and very exciting stories of what God is doing in the darkest parts of the world! If you liked his other episodes you'll love this one. You'll be on the edge of your seat as you listen to him tell of a God that is still doing miracles. What a wonderful God we serve... The State of World Mission was a presentation given at the recent Lausanne Conference on World Evangelisation meeting in Malaysia. This is more than simply dry statistics, interviews are done of church leaders in unreached nations who tell of the gospel's advance among their people. Please stay tuned and remember to vote for our podcast at: and

My Odeo Channel (odeo/d7ef23bf25c45158)

item.title: Episode #14 - Afghanistan - mp3
item.description: We deviate from our normal series to bring you a fresh missionary story from Afghanistan. Our interview is with a missionary working in this troubled country. She has a heart to reach out to the Afghan women, and offers some rare insights into Afghan culture and the issues of ministry and gender. Don't miss this exciting interview. Please stay tuned and remember to vote for our podcast at: and

item.description: Sorry for getting this out a bit late GNN fans. I have been traveling a lot and collecting lotes of great stories about what God is doing among the unreached peoples of the world. item.title: Episode #6 - Bhutan - mp3
item.description: Greetings GNN fans! We continue with our series on stories from the frontlines of mission. We look today at what God is doing in Bhutan, one of the most closed countries in the world. But it isn't closed to God! For those of you who have contacted us about the problem with our audio levels, thanks for your assistance and encouragement. We have made some changes and hope that this helps. As the podcast becomes more successful we hope to buy better equipment so that we can bring a high quality audio experience to all our fans. Keep those emails and voice messages coming! Podsafe Music played in this episode: Eric Vardeman - "The Answer" - Scarecrow Bonfire http://www.BiggerRock.com/ Please stay tuned and remember to vote for our podcast at: and

item.title: Episode #4 - Egypt - mp3
item.description: This is the fourth in a series of stories by Fred Markert reporting on what God is doing in the country of Egypt. In the book of Isaiah chapter 19, there is a prophecy about how one day all Egyptian would worship God, and in fact that did come to pass. For the first 600 years after Christ the country of Egypt followed Jesus. God wants to bring a great revival to Egypt and restore them to salvation in Al Masih Isa (Jesus the Messiah). Please stay tuned and remember to vote for our podcast at: and

item.title: Episode #3 - Algeria - mp3
item.description:
This is part two of our series by Fred Markert sharing stories on what God is doing around the world. This particular episode covers what God is doing in the very unreached country of Algeria. Please stay tuned and remember to vote for our podcast at: and
Music on this podcast is by "Offering" : Offering is a Christian band based out of Richmond, VA, with members from many different denominations and congregation backgrounds.The band plays between 6-12 shows monthly, leading worship in churches as well playing in public venues like coffee houses, outdoor festivals, sports events, and restaurants. Check out their music on Amazon
